\begin{multicols}{2}
{\large \textbf{\textcolor{headerblue}{SUMMARY}}} \\
{`r params$geolevel`} District {`r params$district_number`} is the {`r params$disparity_rank`} most racially disparate {`r params$geolevel`} district in California. It ranks {`r params$outcome_rank`} out of {`r params$total_districts`} {`r params$geolevel`} districts in outcomes such as employment, life expectancy, and homeownership. 

{\large \textbf{\textcolor{headerblue}{BACKGROUND}}} \\
RACE COUNTS analyzed 47 indicators such as employment, life expectancy, and homeownership, for every State {`r params$geolevel`} District and ranked districts by their outcomes and differences in those outcomes among racial groups.

Data sources for indicators include the California Department of Education, the California Office of Justice, the California Office of Environmental Health Hazard Assessment, the U.S. Census Bureau's American Community Survey and others. All data are the most recent data published or within one year of publication. See RaceCounts.org/methodology for more information.
